props.source:
Perspective is designed to operate in a web browsing environment. A Page is the main navigational element in a Perspective Session, so when a Perspective Session starts, it typically begins at the page mounted to the Page URL "/". However, users can directly navigate to any page in a project if they know the URL.

When talking about pages, there are two distinct objects to be aware of: - **Page:** A collection of views that are displayed within a single tab of a browser during runtime. A page consists of at least one view (called a "primary view"), any number of additional views that can be docked along the edges (called "docked views"), and a partial URL associated with the page. - **Page Configuration:** A collection of settings that dictate how the page will behave during runtime, including which views are present on a page, as well as rules for docked views in the page. Thus, Page Configurations are used to define pages that can be opened in the session, while Pages are running instances that are defined by the Page Configuration.

All page configuration happens in the Designer on the Perspective Page Settings tab. Any number of pages can be created for a project, each with their own Primary View and Docked Views. 
- **Configuration Entry:** Each entry must include a Page URL as well as a Primary View. The Page URL defined here is appended to the end of the gateway's perspective URL, typically `<gateway>:8088/data/perspective/client/samplequickstart/`
- **Docked Views:** When configuring a docked view in Page Configuration you can choose to dock the view on a specific Page URL with a set primary view, or you can choose to share the view across all pages under Shared Settings.  Each project can configure a Shared Settings that will be “inherited” by all pages in that project, allowing multiple pages to use the same docked views and corner priority settings.
- **Initial Page URL:** Perspective assumes the initial page within a project will be located at page URL "/". When a session is launched, the session will start at the "/" page. It's recommended that the "home" or starting view for your project uses a page URL of just "/".

Pages can be mounted at URLs that include parameters. These parameters are used to allow a page to be mounted at a dynamic URL, allowing information in the URL to be interpreted as input parameters to the page’s primary view. Our dynamic URL mounting uses a colon to signify that a portion of the URL is meant to by dynamic and map to an input parameter on the page’s primary view.

props.text: Open this view in the Designer: Ignition 101/Feature Views/Perspective Features/Navigation
